oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1949-11-19 - WSM
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording is part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from November 19, 1949. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Red Foley (host,performer) and the Cumberland Valley Boys (performers), Judy Martin (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Hank Williams (performer), Minnie Pearl (performer), and Roy Acuff (performer). Transcribed from Rhein-Main Air Base, Frankfurt, Germany. Second recording is a report by Will R. Mainier, Jr. for WSM program Undercurrents And Current Events. Exact broadcast date unknown. Third recording is part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from April 27, 1940. Hosted by 'Ford' (likely Ford Rush) [unconfirmed] with announcer David Stone. Performance by the McGee Brothers.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Jimmy Dickens; Red Foley; Hank Williams; Minnie Pearl; Roy Acuff; McGee Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Red Foley talks and introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Take An Old Cold Tater (And Wait) (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Red Foley talks -- I Want A Girl (Just Like The Girl That Married Dear Old Dad) (various) -- Prince Albert commercial (Red Foley and Grant Turner) -- Red Foley introduces Hank Williams -- Lovesick Blues (Hank Williams) -- Red Foley introduces Minnie Pearl -- Opening theme -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Closing theme -- Red Foley dedicates a song to Prince Albert -- I'm Throwing Rice (At The Girl I Love) (Red Foley) -- Rod Basfield talks about Prince Albert -- [Squaredance tune] (Roy Acuff) -- Closing statement (Red Foley) -- NBC tone -- Will R. Manier, Jr. reads war report -- Who Broke The Lock (On The Hen House Door) (McGee Brothers) -- Ford [Ruse, unconfirmed] introduces David Stone -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Turner, Grant; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Manier, Will R., Jr.; McGee Brothers; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Undercurrents and current events (Radio program);
